microSituations.title: I'm Lost
actions: Find nearest LRT/MRT station (look for red/green/blue line signs)
Use Moovit or Google Maps (works well)
Ask at info desk or police station
Look for major landmarks (Petronas Towers, KL Tower, Batu Caves)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't panic - KL is navigable. LRT/MRT is efficient.

microSituations.title: Public Transport
actions: Get Touch 'n Go card (RM10 minimum) - works on LRT/MRT/Monorail
RM1-6 per ride depending on distance
Tap card on reader before entering and exiting
LRT/MRT runs 6am-midnight, avoid rush hour 7-9am and 5-7pm
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid taxis during rush hour. LRT/MRT is faster and cheaper.

microSituations.title: Taxi / Ride Share
actions: Grab: cheaper than taxis (RM5-15 short trips)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Use LRT/MRT for most trips. Grab only for late night or specific destinations.

microSituations.title: Quick Bite
actions: Street food: RM5-15 (same food as restaurants)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't eat at tourist trap restaurants. Street food is authentic and cheap.

microSituations.title: Sit-Down Meal
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Eat lunch like locals (12-2pm) for best deals. Dinner after 7pm.

microSituations.title: Dietary Restrictions
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't assume - always ask. Malaysian restaurants are accommodating.

microSituations.title: 15-30 Minutes
actions: Visit a food court for a snack
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't rush. KL is best experienced slowly.

microSituations.title: 1-2 Hours
actions: Batu Caves (free, visit early morning to avoid heat)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Avoid peak times (10am-2pm). Early morning or late afternoon is better.

microSituations.title: Half Day
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. Pick one area and explore deeply.

microSituations.title: Safety Concern
actions: KL is generally safe, but trust your instincts
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: KL is generally safe, but stay alert in tourist areas (pickpockets).

microSituations.title: Scam / Suspicious
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Be polite but firm: 'Tidak, terima kasih' (no thanks) and keep walking.

microSituations.title: Lost Item
actions: Report to embassy if passport stolen
Cancel cards immediately if wallet stolen
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Keep copies of passport/ID separate. Use hotel safe for valuables.

microSituations.title: Essential Phrases
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't worry - English is widely spoken. Communication is easy.

microSituations.title: Ordering Food
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't be embarrassed. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Asking for Help
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Malaysian people are very helpful. English works everywhere.

microSituations.title: Need Rest
actions: Food court break (cheap, sit as long as you want)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't push through exhaustion. Rest is part of travel.

microSituations.title: Too Many Tourists
actions: Leave main areas: walk 10min away from Petronas Towers
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Tourist areas are crowded for a reason, but real KL is 2 blocks away.

microSituations.title: Overwhelmed by Choices
actions: Pick one thing: food OR shopping OR culture
Ask locals: 'Apa yang anda cadangkan?' (what do you recommend?)
microSituations.whatToDoInstead: Don't try to see everything. One great experience beats ten rushed ones.

microSituations.title: If you have 15 minutes
actions: Discover a tiny street you've never heard of

microSituations.title: If you want something social
actions: Join locals at a food court
Visit a market and chat with vendors
Attend a local event (check local listings)

microSituations.title: If you want local flavor
actions: Local neighborhoods away from tourist areas

microSituations.title: Airport to City
actions: KLIA Express: RM55, 28min to city center
